issue.title: Theme switch on load.
issue.body: ### Describe the feature Currently, the site's theme is always on "light" when the website is initially opened and then switches to the user's choice after the website has loaded. This could easily go unnoticed but it would be a nice UX if the theme could be set to the user's preference immediately the site is open rather than switching when the site is loaded. ### Additional information - [X] Would you be willing to help implement this feature? ## Upvote & Fund - We're using [Polar.sh](https://polar.sh/aidenybai) so you can upvote and help fund this issue. - We receive the funding once the issue is completed & confirmed by you. - Thank you in advance for helping prioritize & fund our backlog.

issue.title: Website: Theme Of Website Flashes And Changes From Light To Dark Mode
issue.body:
The theme of the website begins from light mode and changes to dark mode on page load and this might be related to a Nextjs thing. I have done the below screen recording to show the issue:

https://github.com/aidenybai/million/assets/96334363/e3437016-44ac-465a-bb9c-f9b5b68e166b


Check out https://million.dev

issue.title: bug: configuring vite.config.ts

labels.name: 🤖 aspect: dx
labels.description: Concerns developers' experience with the codebase

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
on configure ```vite.config.ts```, when adressing plugins, there is error 'Uncaught ReferenceError: require is not defined', all setup instruction are followed by official docs

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. npm i million
2. configure vite.config.ts
3. edit plugins:plugins: [million.vite(), { ...react(), enforce: 'default' }], OR plugins: [million.vite(), react()]
5. Error => Uncaught ReferenceError: require is not defined

**Expected behavior**
Get compiler configured and Million library working

**Screenshots**
![image](https://github.com/aidenybai/million/assets/80207443/7e421ef0-9a8c-463c-b217-791dbea8678f)
![image](https://github.com/aidenybai/million/assets/80207443/4301d16e-7784-499c-a110-c6aab8afe69e)

**Device (please complete the following information):**
Chrome

**Additional context**
/

comment.body: hmm, for my case If Im using vite, The errors appear here, and this line is injected from million plugin I also tried to follow instruction to use vite-commonjs-plugin but it produces another error also I tried to ignore one by one package appear this error but there is a lot of them
